SIDE ONE
1. HAVA NAGILA - IRV. GOODMAN (Trad.)
.. Let's be gay..."
The best known and most popular song ever to have
out of Israel
"Hava Nagila"has been sung and translated into many languages
and its joyous message has been one of Israel's most effective ambassadors
2. LAMNATSE'ACH SHIR MIZMOR (To the Victor)
GEULA GILL (Psalms -
- D. Seltzer)
"Make a joyful noise to God, all the earth.
Let God arise,
let His enemies
Behold, He who keeps Israel
slumber nor sleep!
The events of the 6-Day War gave these words, (taken from the
new and vigorous meaning. Again - as always - in times of sorrow and joy-
we turn to
to find expression for our deepest and most protound feelings.
3. DONA, DONA - HELENA HENDEL
(A. Zeitlin - Sh. Secunda; Hebrew: N. Hendel
Folk songs have always had a way of overcoming boundaries
place and
language. This delightful Yiddish folk song has long been a favorite of amateur
and professional folk singers everywhere. This version, sung in
4. ADON OLAM (Master of the Universe)
YEHORAM GAON (Trad.)
The strong faith of the Jew in the power of the Almighty
is glorified here in one of the most beautiful traditional Shabbat
songs sung on friday evening after prayers
5. SHALOSH AHAVOTAY (Three Loves)
CHAVA ALBERSTEIN (T. Alyagon -
Thie Iowal hallad tolls the story of a naive. rather Old-lashioned
kind of girl who builds castles in the air and seeks true love.
A special charm is given to the song by Chava Alberstein,
in a vocal sivie that is honest. simole and warm
6. OSEH SHALOM - DUO DAROM
This song which won a prize at the first annually-held Israeli
Chassidic
Judaism and
Sochostial moved elections itse Ret of the
rement. Perhaps the secret of the
song's lasting popularity lies in its eager hope for peace.
7. FINJAN - YAFFA YARKONI
What can be more fun than sitting aro
camofire on a balmy Israeli night, listening to the
"cinian"
8. EYFO AT AHOOVA (Where Are You, My Lovel
YEHORAM GAON (T. Alyagon - L. Favio
An Israeli best-seller! A fantastic hit! Sung by Israel's top singer
Yehoram aon
9. MEDLEY - ELEH CHEMDA LIBEE/YISM'CHU
HASHAMAYIM/VETAHER LIBENU - THE PARVARIM (Trad.)
Together with their burning faith, tradition and joy in life, the Chassidim
brought with them a treasury of irresistible, foot-stomping melodies.
In this medley you will hear some of the tunes taken from that priceless heritage.
1. Haskell/Goodman 2. C. Seagle 4. S. Cohen 5. M. Wilensky 6. B. Nagari 8. A. Weiss 9. Y. Houri
SIDE TWO
1. YERUSHALAIM SHEL ZAHAV (Jerusalem of Gold)
CHAVA ALBERSTEIN & THE PARVARIM (N. She
In the tense days just before the 6-Day War in 1967, Naomi Shemer wrote this
jewel of a song. Little did she dream that is prophere
would soon come
and that
Jews would soon be standing at the wall and with
lears in
'Jerusalem of Gold/Your
air is heady as wine/And the smell of your pines
Is carried by the twilight wind / Pure
come back
to you/ To the wells and the square/While a Shofar calls out/In the Old City."
2. HA'AMEENE YOM YAVO (Believe the Day Will Come)
SHOSHANA DAMARI (R. Klatzkin - M. Baharav)
The constant belief that better days are sure to come is expressed in this opti-
Singer and listeners are swept along by this hope. This song wa
written in
"Believe me, better days will come/ I'll come back to hold you...
3. ME'AL PISGAT HAR HATZOFIM (From Mt. Scopus)
YEHORAM GAON (A. Hameiri-Folk)
Of all the
• written to lerusalem. this.
is perhaps the most beautiful, and certainly the best-
known and most sung in Israel and by Jews everywhere
"From the top of Mt. Scopus / I greet you / Jerusalem
From the
top of Mt. Scopus /I bow to
your glory I Jerusalem."
Yehoram Gaon, Jerusalem-born and bred, sings this lovely
song with all his heart, as only he cal
4. HAIM AT BOCHA O TSOCHEKET
(Are You Laughing or Crying) CHAVA ALBERSTEIN
(Y. Katz- D. Krivoshe
During the 6-Day War a member of Kibbutz Gadot stood on
thong that thience d be i kit war and that from now on
in peace on their kibbutz.
*The earth is a planet / That circles the sun / And living is better
han ovind And someone will tinish What we have begun
My child are you laughing or crying.'
5. ETZ HA'ALON (The Oak Tree)
YEHORAM GAON (Y. Tehar Ley - M. Amarilio)
This lovely, melodious ballad was a prize-winner at the annual
Israel Song Festival, in Jerusalem. A song for that melancholic mood
6. NA'ARA MAMESH OTSAR (What a Girl)
ALLA ALKKI
A haoov. easy-aoid love sona whose reek-sivle melody and beat
7. EREV SHEL SHOSHANIM (Night of Roses)
THE PARVARIM (M. Dor-Y. Hadar)
The
in Israel, if has become a tavorite of lovers
hroughout the world.
8. BASHANA HABA'AH (Anytime of the Year)
YAFFA YARKONI
A joyous, cheerful song, expressing the hope of better days to come
Translated and sung in many languages, the English version
"Anytime of the Year" has become an American hit.
1, 7. Y. Houri 2. S. Cohen 3. D. Seltzer 4. B. Nagari S.S. Cohen 6. A. San 8. O. D'Andrea
